answers.answer: Sudden dramatic increases in blood sugar alter the prescription of the eyes, usually inducing temporary nearsightedness.  20/600 may refer to the uncorrected vision in that eye (the vision without the appropriate prescription in place).  If the eye is anatomically normal, the proper prescription should yield 20/20 vision.  However, you do not want to order the glasses until your sugars have been stable for a while.  Be sure you are under the care of an ophthalmologist to monitor your eyes for signs of diabetes damage.

question: i went to see a otemoligest due to the fact i felt a burning sinsation in my right eye due to my sugar juming up to 428 now i can barley see in that eye at all my question is what does it mean when he says my viison in my right eye is 20/600 he wasnt clear on that
title: right eye vision 20/600
